settings.step_descriptions: Add Grind House Blend espresso and brown sugar together and mix, then leave the mix to cool in the fridge for 1 hour.
Add the coffee mix, Jameson Caskmates and Tia Maria to a shaker and shake thoroughly to mix.
Wash your shaker and add Baileys Cream and ice.
Double strain over a teaspoon to create a layer of cream.
Finish with a single coffee bean to garnish.

settings.nice_to_have: 105ml Tia Maria, or any coffee liquor - 15ml
settings.schema_text: 105ml Tia Maria, or any coffee liquor - 15ml

settings.nice_to_have: 350ml Coffee mix (4:1 ratio of coffee and brown sugar)

settings.title: Irish Espresso Martini
settings.before_we_start_content: This might look like our classic espresso martini, but it’s not. Something for those hot summer days when you need something stronger than an iced coffee…
settings.final_touch_content:
Enjoy your Grind coffee black or with milk.
We recommend the Grind Milk Frother, if you’re using milk for the perfect coffee.

settings.title: This cocktail tastes best with Grind coffee. Subscribe and save now!
settings.content_body: Use code GETSTARTED and get your first delivery for £9.95, plus a free refillable Grind tin and free shipping. No fuss - you can change, skip or cancel your subscription at any time.
settings.selling_point_content_1: Our pods and packaging are compostable and plastic-free.
settings.selling_point_content_2: All of our coffee is certified organic by the Soil Association.
settings.selling_point_content_3: Subscribe to letterbox-friendly refills and get a free Grind tin.

settings.title: Grind One Machine.
settings.excerpt: Easy to use, beautiful, quick and (importantly) consistent in terms of brew pressure, the Grind One is a great way to serve our Grind pods at home.

settings.title: Espresso.
settings.excerpt: The espresso is one of the fastest, and most unique ways of making coffee. It’s fast, the flavours are intense, and when extracted correctly, it can make a beautifully complex cup of coffee.

settings.title: French Press.
settings.excerpt: Classic, timeless, and one of the oldest, most reliable ways of brewing filter coffee at home.
